fields.description: Currently, when the customer satisfaction survey is filled in by selecting the star rating, the star rating is actually submitted, but the text changes in a way that isn't very prominent and it also can confuse the submitter whether the form has been submitted or not. It should be more prominent for the customer. It gives the impression that until a comment is made the form will not be submitted.
fields.summary: Customer satisfaction survey submission should be more prominent for the customer

fields.description:
*Summary:* 
 When a user creates a NextGen ServiceDesk project selecting the default language as German, Chinese, etc (Not English) then custom-fields get created in that language (here it is in German).

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Create a Project of type NextGen Servicedesk.
 # Select the default language German (Not English) 

!image-2020-06-24-16-18-32-079.png|width=86,height=97!

3. Click create

4. Goto Jira Settings>> Issues>>Custom fields.
 Check for fields created as locked in another language.

!image-2020-06-24-16-19-19-795.png|width=458,height=41!

*Expected result:*
 These fields should be hidden alike for the NextGen software project.

*Actual result:*
 Custom Fileds are appearing with another language without an edit/hidden option.

*Workaround :*
 There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira Nextgen Servicedesk project creates custom filed in other language when default language is not English while creating the project

fields.description:
This is a suggestion for Jira Service Desk Next Gen

From the Queue Viewer, I'd love to see the ability to open an issue in a sidebar similar to JS NG.

 

!image-2020-06-23-17-23-05-347.png!
fields.summary: Open issues in sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you have more than one next-gen project with field types dropdown/checkbox with the same name, the values cannot be different, otherwise Jira will thrown an error saying that the value X doesn't exist for that fields when using JQL on queues and SLA goals. E.g. Project A has the field Urgency with options 1/2 and project B has the field Urgency, but with values 4/5, when trying to create a queue with JQL Urgency = 1 on project A, Jira will thrown the following error "The option '1' for field 'Urgency' does not exist", even if the value 1 exists for the field Urgency on project A.
 !Screen Shot 2020-06-23 at 16.22.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two next-gen projects;
# Change the values for the Urgency field on one project;
# Try to create a queue using the following JQL Urgency = <Value>.

h3. Expected Results
Jira keeps both projects separated and the fields can have different values on different projects.

h3. Actual Results
Jira throws the error "The option 'VALUE' for field 'FieldName' does not exist". See the video below:
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/rRulG2QN

h3. Notes
This problem just happens to the field types dropdown and checkbox, which are the types that can have options.

h3. Workaround
- Use different names for the fields;
- Use the same values for the fields;
- It is also possible to use the custom field id instead of the name. See this video: https://share.getcloudapp.com/WnubYOov
fields.summary: Next-gen dropdown/checkbox field types cannot have different values on multiple projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
From the queues, you can now comment, assign, link, and delete issues. But while performing those actions, the notifications are not being generated for those actions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Service Desk project;
# Go to the queues;
# Use the bulk actions to assign issues to a user.

h3. Expected Results
The notifications for those actions are generated and sent to the users.

h3. Actual Results
The notifications are not generated.

h3. Workaround
Perform the actions from inside the issues.
fields.summary: Bulk edits from queues are not generating notifications

fields.description:
It would be nice if an organization manager could be specified (even if a portal-only user) so that the organization manager can manage (e.g., add or remove users in the organization).

Duplicated ticket: "Keeping track of and managing all of these organizations is very hard, and there is a need to provide a way for customers to manage them all themself (self-service)."
fields.summary: Allow a designated portal user to be a customer Organization's manager

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Gadgets in Confluence pages don't load in the Service Desk Portal articles.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page in a space associated with a Service Desk project;
# Add the Jira Gadgets *Filter Results* and *Starred Filters*;
# Publish the page
# Go to the Service Desk Portal and open the article where the gadgets were added

h3. Expected Results
The gadgets will load properly

h3. Actual Results
The gadgets don't load and an error message appears: _Gadgets can only be viewed in browsers_

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira Gadgets in Confluence pages don't load in the Service Desk Portal articles

fields.description:
Currently, Service desk agents are able to share issues with any customer of a project with no indication that they are violating the customer permissions setting.
For example, if the permissions are set to only allow customer to share issues with other customers in their JSD Organization, an agent can still add users outside of that organization to the request participants field.

In addtion, there is no indication of which organization that a user belongs to in the picker, so it can be difficult to notice if one is violating this setting on accident.

As such, I would like to propose the following enhancements for your consideration:
- allow admins to limit the valid request participants of an issue based on the customer setting (plus agents)
- Allow users the ability to specify the organization in their search/autocomplete to limit results to only members of the organization.
fields.summary: As a Jira Service Desk Project Admin, Allow control of request participants based on customer permissions

fields.description:
When an org user is a site-admin and not a JSD agent, the users will show up in a JSD project's customers list. These site admin users have never used the JSD portal but still show up in the customers list.

This can be confusing since the customers list should only list customers, and not site admins. 

If this is expected behavior for the customers list, there should be an option to hide these site admin users to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Ability to hide site-admins (who are not JSD agents) in JSD Customers list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While creating a new series on a report, the first time the pop-up opens the field "Filter by" can be edited. If you cancel and add a new series, the field will be greyed out, preventing the user to add a JQL to it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a report or create a custom report;
# Add a series and try to edit the "Filter by" field.

h3. Expected Results
The field is editable and you can enter a JQL on it.

h3. Actual Results
The "Filter By" field is greyed out, preventing the user to add a JQL.

While creating a custom report: https://share.getcloudapp.com/YEupydqK
While editing an existing report: https://share.getcloudapp.com/NQug1vDX

h3. Workaround
Reload the browser page and try to edit/add the series again.
fields.summary: Field "Filter by" is greyed out on reports while adding/editing a series

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding or editing a series in a report, the *Filter by* field occasionally doesn't load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a custom report.
 # Click Edit on a series.

h3. Expected Results
The Filter by field loads.

h3. Actual Results
The Filter by field is displaying a loading animation and does not finish loading.

 !edit_a_series.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the page usually fixes the issue.
fields.summary: Filter by field not loading when adding or editing a report series

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding assignee = currentUser() to a filter in a custom report of SLA average time ignores the SLA calendar and displays results based on 24/7 SLA calendar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom report with the series "Time to resolution (Avg.)"
 # Filter the series by assignee = currentUser()
 # Save the report

h3. Expected Results
The report should show the average time as counted by the SLA according to the SLA calendar.

h3. Actual Results
The report shows the average time as counted by the 24/7 calendar

h3. Workaround
Filter by a specific user instead by adding the JQL "assignee = userID".
fields.summary: Using currentUser() in custom report series filter causes inconsistent report data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Images in a confluence page which are part of */include* for another confluence page are broken

h3. Steps to Reproduce

#  Create a kb article "*test*" with images within a space linked to a JSD project
#  Create another kb article "*test-2*" and add the contents of the above created pages using /include
# The page looks perfect when viewed from confluence.
# View the same page from JSD project(kb) and you will find the images broken.

 !Screenshot 2020-06-17 at 2.29.23 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-06-17 at 2.28.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

Images should be shown.

h3. Actual Results

Images appear to be broken.



h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Images in the kb fetched from another confluence page(/include) appear to be broken

fields.description:
When a customer vote in the email for satisfaction, the service desk open a screen to add an optional comment, but if he don't want to add it, look for something to go out. 
There should be a button to do more confortable to leave this screen.
fields.summary: Add an exit or close button in the satisfaction optional comment screen

fields.description:
*Details:*
At this time Jira has a few Context variables as described on [this|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-expressions#context-variables] article.
{quote}
Depending on the context in which a Jira expression is evaluated, different context variables may be available:
* user (User)
* app (App) made by Connect Apps
* issue (Issue)
* issues (List<Issue>)
* project (Project)
* sprint (Sprint)
* board (Board)
* serviceDesk (ServiceDesk)
* customerRequest (CustomerRequest)
{quote}

It would be nice to have a context variable such as *Request* that would allow us to analyze some information before the issue context. For example, Issue Type, Request Type and Request Type Channel are only available on the *Issue* context.

*Use case*
Sometimes users may want to restrict issue creation based on specific conditions but at this time we can only access this data after the ticket was already created.
fields.summary: Add a new Jira Expressions context variable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a customer email address already have an Atlassian Account ( even though the access already revoke) , then the customer sign up a customer account from Customer portal , they couldn't finished the sign up process because they get 500 error code after clicking the "Sign up" button in the invitation email :-

 !Screenshot 2020-06-16 at 9.59.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite a user as JIRA user in the instance
 # Then , revoke the access
# Then , go to Customer Portal
# Use the same email address to sign up customer account
# Then , click the "Sign up" button at the invitation email

h3. Expected Results
User able to complete the sign up process , or mention "The account already existed in the instance".

h3. Actual Results
Return 500 error code
 !Screenshot 2020-06-16 at 10.02.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Go to User Management and delete the user.
fields.summary: Customer getting 500 error code when clicking "Sign Up" button in the invitation email if their account already existed

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If an automation rule in JSD fails (due to any reason), the user does not receive any notification and have to find out by actively looking into the automation rules
h4. *Expected Results*

A way to set up notifications for automation rules which no longer work or failed
fields.summary: Notification for failed automation rules

fields.description:
As a JSD administrator using next-gen projects, I need to be able to "clone" next-gen JSD project for versioning and testing and to make major changes to a production system without effecting operation (maintaining the same issue types, workflow scheme, notification scheme, ...).
The new project will be equal to the "structure of father" but without issues.
fields.summary: Clone a Next-gen JSD project

fields.description:
h3. Description
When using Jira Cloud for Sheets and exporting the SLA fields, they appear as a text, and not as time or duration values. 

This blocks users from applying different formats on this data. 

 !image-2020-06-15-20-43-35-101.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion: 
Allows Jira to export such data as the corresponding data, such as Date and Time, Duration, etc.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Sheets exports SLA values as text

fields.description:
Current Issues Scenario: When someone submits a ticket via the "email" request type, it creates a new ticket. Now, if others are CC'd on the note and they begin to add additional information responding to the request, it creates a new ticket every single time. 

 

Suggestion: Are there quickparts or some text that can be added to the subject line, so that when anyone replies or sends and email with, for example (ticket #1234) in the subject line, the reply and new information is added to the ticket, rather then generating a new ticket that needs to be merged?
fields.summary: Reduce new tickets being created when responding to an email/using the email request type function.

fields.description:
Ability to embed confluence page contents in the comment section of a Jira Issue.
As of now, there is something close that can be achieved via an add-on for Jira Server: [C4J|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1222263/c4j-content-display-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview&_ga=2.202882389.557664297.1592202044-2103430335.1588174825]. But none for Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: Embed confluence page content in the comment.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Next-Gen JIRA Service Desk Cloud*.
{panel}
h3. Summary

When adding a comment to a Next-gen JIRA Service Desk request, the @mention feature does not work for customers or request participants. unless those users have made a comment on the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a customer create a request
 # As an administrator, view the issue in the Issue Navigator
 # Type a comment and use the @mention feature to mention the customer

h3. Desired Results
 * A list of suggestions will appear which you can choose the customer or request participant

h3. Actual Results
 * A list of users appears but this list does not contain the customer or any request participants
 ** Any customers and request participants who are agents or collaborators will appear.

h3. Workaround
 * Have the participant to make a comment. They will be only mention-able in the issue which they made comment.
fields.summary: Unable to @mention Customer or Request Participant in Next-gen Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having the email notification reduced to batched notifications, makes it easier to know what has changed in one email rather than multiple. However when using custom domain for notifications, the email notification won't be batched anymore

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Service Desk Project
 # Claim your domain
# Configure SPF as mentioned in [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-979428371.html] to send email on behalf
# Change the notification scheme email to your custom domain email e.g. support@mydomain.com
# Have this option select in this Configuration page https://<your-atlassian.net>/secure/admin/SDConfiguration.jspa
## No, only send Jira Service Desk notifications to customers (recommended) under *Notifications*
# Create a ticket, add yourself as the assignee and another Agent user as watcher and have the ticket assigned to another account that is customer only
# Make multiple changes on the ticket.

h3. Expected Results
The watcher of the ticket being an Agent should receive batched email notifications

h3. Actual Results
The watcher of the ticket being an Agent, receives multiple notification for each update

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available, as the change of email shouldn't affect the behaviour of the notification scheme
fields.summary: Switching Notification email to custom domain causes batched notifications for Agents not to be batched anymore

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently when the customer loads a request create screen, the JQL context does not have access to all the request types the customer could possible select. It only has access to the `customerRequest` itself which doesn't populate the possible request types prior to use selecting them and even then only contains the actual request type property that the customer selected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new service desk project with some pre-configured request types
 # Try to use JQL to hide certain elements on the `Request Create Property Panel` based on a particular request type present

h3. Expected Results

The query expression should have access to all the available request types as a global variable inside the "Request create property panel"
h3. Actual Results

The user can only access the customerRequest variable in the context of "Request Create Property Panel" and the child requestType field in that object only corresponds to the requestType that the customer selects.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add all available request type options available to a customer creating ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new issue view, JSD allows the modification of issue layouts at the request type level. This means that for any issue types without request types, such as subtasks, there is no way to edit the issue layout.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Service Desk project create a subtask
 # Try to edit the issue layout in order to remove the request type

h3. Expected Results

It's possible to edit the issue layout and remove the request type since it's not used.
h3. Actual Results

It's not possible to edit the issue layout because the issue type doesn't have a request type.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Allow editing issue layouts of issue types without request types

fields.description:
h3. Problem

We are trying to create an SLA that restarts every time an update to the customer is required, but using the current configurations, it needs an event as changing the status to be restarted. It would be good to have the ability to create an SLA that is recurring depending on specific parameters.

h3. Suggested resolution

Ability to create a recurring SLA with defined parameters.
fields.summary: Ability to create a recurring SLA with defined parameters

fields.description:
Currently, there are 2 places to manage customers *Customer* and *Peoples* tab in a project. If a customer is added/invited to a project it is added to *Customer* tab and added to *People* tab as well and becomes hard to manage.
 Customer/people management in JSD is extremely confusing. 
 It's a bad idea to have two similar but distinctly different places to manage access.
fields.summary: Have only one place to manage the Customers in Jira Service Desk.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, on the customer portal login screen, the option to login using either Microsoft Apps or Service Desk / JIRA credentials is present. This can lead to confusion for service desk portal customers, as they might believe that they are able to log in using Microsoft credentials (which only service desk agents can use that option), and that will not work.
h3. Suggested Solution

I believe we should remove Microsoft Apps log in from the customer portal log in screen.
fields.summary: Remove Microsoft Apps Login From Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For Service Desk projects with the new issue view, you have no way to control sub-task screens. Service Desk does that configuration under Request Types and sub-tasks cannot have a Request Type.

It's not possible to use the "Configure" feature to edit the issue layout because the Subtask doesn't have a Request Type.

The same applies to issue types that don't have a request type associated with.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Service Desk project create a subtask;
 # Try to edit the issue layout in order to remove the request type;

h3. Expected Results
It's possible to edit the issue layout and remove the request type since it's not used.

h3. Actual Results
It's not possible to edit the issue layout because the issue type doesn't have a request type.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: In the new issue view it's not possible to edit the issue layout of subtasks to remove the request type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when searching in the customer portal, the maximum displayed results that can be displayed at a time is 5 for request types. If more than 5 requests types match the search query, only the top 5 results will be returned.

h3. Proposed Solution

Increase the number of results that can be displayed in the portal search functionality.
fields.summary: Increase the number of search result returned on the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the Customers page (/jira/servicedesk/projects/<ProjectKey>/customers), searching for certain customers who have a different name to their email address, by the email address exactly, does not return the user as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On the Customers page (<instance hostname>/jira/servicedesk/projects/<ProjectKey>/customers) add {{mr.anderson@example.comdonotuse}} as a customer.
# go to the user management UI -> Jira Service Desk Customers (e.g. http://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/jira-service-desk/portal-only-customers), and click "Edit full name" to set their name to something that doesn't look like their email address, like "Mr Anderson".
# Try the search on the Customers page with the string {{mr.anderson@example.comdonotuse}}.
# Try the same search bar with "Mr Anderson" or any substring thereof.

h3. Expected Results

The user is returned when searching by either name or email address.

h3. Actual Results

The user is returned when searching by name, but not by email address.

h3. Workaround

As a partial workaround, either:
* Search for the user by name, rather than email address, or
* Search for the user by email address on the Jira settings -> User management -> Jira Service Desk customers page.
fields.summary: Searching for a user with particular email address formulations in the Customers page by email doesn't return the user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you setup an automation rule on a timed event like *In status for xxx days* and the rule is set to run as the *user who triggered the rule* then it fails to run with the message *This user was deleted* (Already being tracked under JSDCLOUD-7993).

Additionally, the automation log doesn't show the issue key relevant to the failed automation rule.

!Screen Shot 2020-06-11 at 2.27.28 pm.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Service Desk Automation Rules
 # Options > Run Rules As: User who triggered the rule
 # Add a trigger for "When this happens...": Time in Status and specify a status for any amount for an amount of time.
 # Add an action.
 # Let the rule execute.
 # Check the automation logs.

h3. Expected Results

The automation log shows the issue key of the failed automation rule.
h3. Actual Results

The automation log doesn't show the issue key of the failed automation rule.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation on a timed event running as *User who triggered the rule* produces incomplete logs

fields.description: As an agent, I would like to choose from automated canned responses based on request types and triggers so that I can efficiently respond to customers and autofill Jira Service Desk ticket data fields.
fields.summary: Automated Canned Responses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to edit the domain in the Allowlist if the domain entry has long text. The data at the Allowlist popup screen are not scrollable (Left - Right) causing the "Data Updated" and "Action" column can't be seen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update the domain with a long text
  !Screenshot 2020-06-10 at 7.12.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The screen can be scroll (Left - Right)

h3. Actual Results
The screen can't be scroll (Left - Right)

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Unable to edit the domain in the Allowlist if the domain entry have long text due to the screen can't be scroll (Left - Right)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

When there are any configuration warnings in a service desk project the project admins are unaware of it unless they manually check the configurations.
For example:
Automation rule configurations will show a warning icon within the rule configuration if there are any issues with the automation setup. Or, the request type configuration, will show a warning if the default value selected in the hidden field is no longer available, etc. 

h3. Proposed solution

Similarly to how there is a pop-up on the project when there is a project permission scheme configuration warning, having some sort of pop-up message or alert detecting issues within the project setup overall would help to inform project admins and to correct these warnings.
fields.summary: provide a way of informing Jira service desk project admins of any configuration errors/warnings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to highlight the "Organization" field value at the transition screen in the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add "Organization" field for any transition screen
 # Then , create an issue and update the "Organization" field with an organization value.
 # Then, transition the issue to pop up the transition screen.
# Try to highlight the organization value with the mouse.

Here I attached the screen recording :-
 [^Recording #6.mp4] 

Tested using Chrome and Safari.

h3. Expected Results
Able to highlight the organization's value.

h3. Actual Results
Not able to highlight the organization field value. 

h3. Workaround
Either:
* Use the keyboard to select and delete entries in the Organizations field, or
* Use the old issue view.
fields.summary: Unable to highlight "Organization" field value at the transition screen in the new issue view.

fields.description: We need a way to connect a custom email to Jira Service Desk outgoing messages so that email notifications are actually being sent from that custom email account and not just spoofing the account. It should connect and authenticate similarly to how the custom email connects for incoming requests. This would take care of many problems that currently exist with emails going to spam, etc.
fields.summary: Send outgoing emails from authenticated custom email address

fields.description:
Would like to have a more detailed description of why the automation failed at a particular point.
The error for a few circumstances are very generic and does not give a detailed description like below:
"_We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file._"

The above error was thrown when the issue type bug in the destination project did not have a proper workflow assigned.

Hence opening this request to add more details on the automation log.
fields.summary: Descriptive message on automation error log.

fields.description:
h3. User Story
As a Zapier user, I can create Zaps that run when a request is created or updated using the New Request and Updated Request triggers. I would like to only trigger this for a particular request type.

Possible solution(s)
Add an (optional) configuration dropdown be able to select a single request type for the trigger.
fields.summary: As a Zapier user, I want to select which request type I want to trigger zaps on

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to change the words which denote the comment type in Jira Service Desk between "internal" ("Add internal Note") and "external" ("Reply to Customer") comments.

Because not all service desk projects will service "customers" and some organizations may assign special meaning to the term "customer" in the context of their organization, it may be confusing to see that term show up in some service desk issues. In order to alleviate this, I would like to suggest either changing the verbiage to make it more specific to whom the comment will be visible:

"reply to request", "reply to participants", "reply to reporter", "Reply", "Comment issue"

Or, provide a method for a user to be able to change the verbiage to suit their specific needs.
fields.summary: Allow Customization of comment type selector verbiage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue is created via email with long body text (> 32,767 characters), it will not be added to "Description" field in the new issue view. Only the old issue view will be updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email to JSD project email request with > 32,767 characters.
 # After the issue is created, check the new issue view and the old issue view.

h3. Expected Results
Both views will be updated with the "Description" value.

h3. Actual Results
Only the old issue view has the "Description" value. From the logs it return the error below :-
{code}
"message":"DESCRIPTION with id 1117494 could not be converted from wiki to ADF: Rich text is not present"
{code}

For a next-gen project, an issue with an empty "Description" field is created.

h3. Workaround
If issue descriptions longer than 32,767 characters are needed, attach the content as a file instead of sending it in the email body.
fields.summary: Issue created via email with long "Description" character (more than 32K) will leave the "Description" field blank in the "new issue view"

fields.description:
Description:
 To bulk edit all comments to be Internal only and not viewable by the customer.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit comment

fields.description:
We should have the ability to use a customer user picker field and automate it to the assignee field in automation for jira. 

I have been over this so many ways but it is very hard to call this out with out using another field like component.
fields.summary: Customer user picker field  automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing linked assets from the issue view, the ordering of the assets differs on each page load. This is confusing for the end user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue
 # Link multiple assets to the issue
 # View the linked assets by opening the assets glance, noting the order
 # Reload the page and view the linked assets again. They will appear in a different order

h3. Expected Results

Linked assets should appear in the same order
h3. Actual Results

Linked assets appear in a random order
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Linked assets should have a predictable sort order

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There are some issue statuses: (Waiting for support) & (Waiting for customer) that auto-generated by Jira Service Desk are categorized with a "No Category". The "No Category" is not allowed in normal Jira usage where all statues are required to be categorized into: 

* To Do
* In Progress
* Done

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira Service Desk.
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Check the workflow(for Service or Service Request type).

h3. Expected Results
Service Desk creates the workflow with all the status in a valid category, "To Do", "In Progress" or "Done".

h3. Actual Results
Service Desk creates two status, "Waiting for support" and "Waiting for customer" without a category, they are set to "No Category" with the grey color.
Normally when you create a status you cannot choose "No Category".
Having a status with no category can affect the "Sort by Status" in Advanced Roadmaps and the Kanban board with the "Hide Completed issues" feature. Issues on a status without a category will be removed from the board as well as done issues.

h3. Workaround
You can change the category of the status after it has been created.
fields.summary: Service Desk workflow creates status without category

fields.description:
JSD supports multiple footer extension points such as {{atl.footer}} and {{serviceDeskPortalFooter}}, but neither appear on the portal article page.

This suggestion relates to the community discussion in [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/how-to-add-servicedeskportalfooters-or-similar-to-jsd-cloud-knowledgebase-articles/38797].
fields.summary: Provide support for a footer extension point on the portal article page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Originally reported here: [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/webitem-url-not-work-on-jira-service-desk/38713].

If a Connect app has a web-item with an associated web-panel, the panel (full-page) does not load and gets redirected to queues. This affects JSD projects only, not Jira Core  or Jira Software projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app with a web-item with location "jira.project.sidebar.plugins.navigation" and a web-panel that references the web-item's location.
 # Install the app on an instance.
 # Go to a JSD project.
 # Click on the web-item in the sidebar.

See [https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/webitem-url-not-work-on-jira-service-desk/38713] for an example.
h3. Expected Results

The web-panel associated with the web-item is loaded.
h3. Actual Results

The user is redirected to queues.
h3. Workaround

Use jiraProjectPages module - [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/modules/page/] instead (although this is disruptive to change for existing apps).
fields.summary: Navigating to a Connect web-item with a web-panel in JSD projects redirects to queues instead of loading the panel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you are adding an approval step to a next-gen project, it allows you to create a field instead of using an existing one. When you create that field, it is not possible to delete it afterward. If you run a GET in the fields, the approver field can still be seen after deleting the approval step.

h3. Environment

Approval step on next-gen workflow.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a next-gen project;
# Add an approval step in the workflow, creating an approver field to it;
# Delete the approval step;
# Run the [Get fields|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/#api-rest-api-3-field-get] API:
{code:html}
curl -D- -X GET \
  --url 'https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/field' \
  --user 'email:token' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}

h3. Expected results

The approver field shouldn't be there anymore since I deleted the step from the workflow.

h3. Actual result

The field will still be shown there and there is no way to delete it.

h3. Workaround

Raise an issue with the support [here|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] mentioning this bug.
fields.summary: Unable to delete existing approver fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, on the customer portal, the content of the article is seen under the name of the article and there is no configuration to remove it
  
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option to hide the article content and just display the name of the article on the portal.

h3. Workaround:
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to hide the article content on the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As documented in https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/edit-the-content-of-your-customer-notifications/, the variable  ${request.details} should show the full details of a request including the creation date, request type, summary, and the same fields configured as visible in the request type setting.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the Customer Notification: Request created
 # Insert the ${request.details} into the content

h3. Expected Results
The notification displays the request details
h3. Actual Results
The notification displays ${request.details} as plain text

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding ${request.details} to notification templates do not work

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
The column width in the queue view cannot be configured causing a field which has a relatively short text to appear wider occupying the queue landscape greater.

h3. Suggested solution
Add the ability to configure the queue columns width
fields.summary: Add the ability to configure the queue columns width

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When a new Multi-line text custom field is created and added to the create issue screen of a project, all request types that use that issue type will show the new field under the "Description fields", even if there are no values. The admin must go to each of the request types to drag it and drop to the hidden when empty section.

h3. Suggested resolution
Make those fields go to the hidden when empty section by default, as it is for other custom field types.
fields.summary: Multi-line text custom fields are added to the "Description fields" on request types by default

fields.description:
(!) This issue is intermittent
h3. Issue Summary
Occasionally emails sent to the default Atlassian-provided email address for an incoming email channel in a Jira Service Desk project will be delivered multiple times and result in duplicate tickets created by the JSD mail handlers. This can be seen from the incoming email logs at project settings > email requests > view log.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send an email to a Jira Service Desk mail handler (default Atlassian-provided address, NOT a custom email channel);
# Check for the incoming email logs.

h3. Expected Results
The email only creates one ticket.

h3. Actual Results
The same email creates duplicated tickets.
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-22 at 11.01.01.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround to prevent the duplicate emails being created. Duplicate requests can be deleted.
fields.summary: Emails sent to default email channels occassionally create duplicate tickets

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no public API to retrieve email logs. Admin will not aware when email stop working unless they notice there's no issue created, or going to the email logs to check the logs. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a REST API to retrieve the logs.

h3. Why this is important
Admin will not aware when email stop working unless they notice there's no issue created, or going to the email logs to check the logs. So, when having the API they can retrieve the logs without login.
fields.summary: SysLog for Email Connection/Processing Logs

fields.description:
Currently, customers using the portal to create issues have no ability to format their description, while Agents can do so through the agent view. 

This can make it very difficult for the customer to communicate their requests/issues in a readable manner. It also makes it difficult for them to include links, and paste images inline. 

Adding a rich text editor to description fields and comments in the portal view would make the portal much more user friendly four our customers.
fields.summary: Add rich text editor to customer portal

fields.description:
It seems that requests in the service desk portal view are hidden by default, and the user has to click "Show details" to see the request description. 

At the very least, admin should have the ability to make issue details shown by default. 

!image-2020-05-29-11-21-55-297.png!
fields.summary: Show request details by default in customer portal view

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
Currently, in the automation rules: action, it's possible to select the approvers but it requires individual users to be selected.

h3. Suggested solution
Add the ability to select approver groups in the automation rules: action

h3. Why is this important
In the even that the approvers list require change, admins would need to edit the whole automation rule to make sure that each approvers are current. If a group can be selected, we can maintain them from the User Management directly.
fields.summary: Add the ability to select approver groups in the automation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When clicking on the "Syntax Help" icon while creating a JQL based report element it goes to a 404 error page.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Edit a custom report in JSD
# Edit Series
# Click (?) icon
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected
Open link to JQL help page

h3. Actual
404 page at:
https://<site>.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<pkey>/reports/custom/1/undefined
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
None, will be added here when available
fields.summary: Broken JQL Help link in Edit Series of JSD Custom Report - returning 404 error

fields.description: When creating a linked ticket, I want the "copy attachment" and "copy links" checkboxes to be checkoff by default.
fields.summary: Create a linked ticket, I want the copy attachment and copy links checkboxes to be enabled by default.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an email (.msg) is send to a JSD project from outlook running on a windows machine, the .eml attachments with the email are added as plain texts (with windows encoding appended to the file) rather than as attachments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email with attachments to create a issue on a JSD project from outlook running on a windows machine.

h3. Expected Results

Issue is successfully created with the email attachments added as ticket attachment
h3. Actual Results

Issue is successfully created but email attachments added as plain text to the ticket.
h3. WorkAround

Current Workaround is to add the attachments manually.
h3. Notes

This bug is only seen on emails sent from outlook running on windows machine.
fields.summary: Incoming email to create issue adds the .eml attachments as plain text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The PDF Macro displays a static image of the first page of the PDF file when viewed in an article in the knowledge base or in the Help Center portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a PDF file using the PDF Macro to a Confluence page that is connected to a Jira Service Desk project as a knowledge base.
 # Open the article in the Jira Service Desk Help Center or in the agent's knowledge base.

h3. Expected Results
The PDF Macro should display the PDF as interactive with the possibility to scroll through the pages of the PDF.

h3. Actual Results
A static image of the first page of the PDF is shown. 

h3. Workaround
Adding the PDF file to the Confluence page using the "Files and images" option allows customers to download the PDF from the knowledge base article.
fields.summary: PDF Macro displays a static image of the PDF in a knowledge base article

fields.description:
It would be awesome to have the ability to edit the email address used when someone is invited to be an *Agent*.

For the time being, it's only possible to accomplish it on customer notifications. 

Finally, an option to customize the invitation email for agents also.
fields.summary: Change invite email address for agent
Translated components aren't sorted alphabetically in the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Editing a customer's comment in next-gen causes the comment visibility changed to internal comment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment as a customer from email/portal
 # Edit the comment as an agent

h3. Expected Results
Comment visibility remains as "Reply to Customer"
h3. Actual Results
The comment appears as internal

h3. Notes
Changing the tab from "Add internal note" to "Reply to Customer" does not change the behavior

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editing customer comments in Next-Gen sets the comment as internal comment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no setting in Service Desk that prevents Agents from adding customers to a project by using the "Add Customers" button from the Project page

h3. Suggested Solution

There is a setting in JIRA Admin > Applications > JIRA Service Desk > Configuration that prevents Agents from adding new organizations, so it might be helpful to have a similar setting here as well that prevents agents from adding new customers.
fields.summary: Prevent Service Desk Agents from Creating New Customers from the Project Page

fields.description:
*Issue:*
The advice-window message blocks the visibility of *Actions* column

*Cause:*
Dimensions of the pop-up

*Suggestion:*
Change the position/size of the advice/ let it be closable.

*Workaround:*
Using the Chrome developer tools to reduce the size of the window by manually hacking its dimensions which revealed the hidden *Actions*.
fields.summary: Ability to move/change the size of the advice window on Request forms.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Wrong request type in the queue and filter view after changing the issue type in one project or moving between projects
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move a service desk issue across projects - or - simply change the issue type on one issue on one project
 # While moving the issue, change the issue type - or - change the issue type on one issue for one project
!image-2020-05-25-13-53-40-187.png|thumbnail!
 # After moving the issue, the request type field will be empty in the issue view:
!image-2020-05-25-13-55-12-726.png|thumbnail!
 # But in the queue view/filter view, the request type will be mapped with a value from the source project
!image-2020-05-25-13-56-33-845.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The Request type value should be empty as well in the queue/filter view
h3. Actual Results

The request type has a value from the source project
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Wrong request type in the queue and filter view after changing the issue type

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When an attachment field is on an issue and an attachment is added by the customer, it's added as an external comment and visible to the reporter.

When an attachment field appears elsewhere, e.g. on a transition screen, the attachment is not visible to the reporter. 

h3. Solution
Change the default behaviour of the attachments field to be always visible (or provide an option to configure), unless the attachment is added in an internal comment/note, in which case keep it private.

h3. Workaround
For attachments to be visible to the reporter, add them as part of an external comment.
fields.summary: As an agent, I want attachments added to Jira Service Desk requests to be visible by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
KB articles are not being suggested when creating a ticket for Atlassian Accounts without licenses

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Service Desk project with a Confluence Space as a Knowledge Base;
 # Add an Atlassian Account with no licenses (*Site Access* toggled ON, *Application Accesses* toggled OFF) as a customer to that project
 # Log in as the customer and access the project via the Portal
 #* *NOTE:* impersonating the user as a site-admin *will show the articles*. To reproduce this bug you must login as the customer via https://id.atlassian.com/ on an incognito window
 # Select a Request Type and type in a Summary keyword that should suggest an article

*NOTE:* KB searching (eg inputting the same exact text as you would on the ticket Summary) *does* work when executed on the portal's Home search bar.

h3. Expected Results
Articles are suggested

h3. Actual Results
Articles are *NOT* suggested
* !kb.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: KB articles are not being suggested when creating a ticket for Atlassian Accounts without licenses

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Ability to select multiple requests and set status within Service Desk queue view
fields.summary: Ability to select multiple requests and set a status within Service Desk queue view

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently, disabling/enabling customer notification is an ultimatum applied to all customers. It is not possible to single out a list of customers that should receive a specific set of "Customer Notification".

The only way possible is for the request participant/reporter to manually go and turn off the receiving notification via the portal. There is no control point for the administrator to decide if a customer should receive the notification or not individually.

*Suggested Idea*

It would be great if the existing tags within the "Customer notification" such as "Customers involved" or "Reporter" can be expanded to a grouping of customers, or individual customers' input, so that that the administrator can include or exclude on a more detailed level.
fields.summary: The Ability to choose specific customers to receive "Customer Notification"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The description of rules added to workflow transitions shows the incorrect number of users if one of them is removed from the project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a next-gen project, edit the workflow of a request type
 # Select a transition > Add rule > Restrict who can move a request
 # Choose the users that should have permission to transition requests
 # Go back to the project settings > Internal access > remove from the project a user that is added to the rule
 # Go back to the workflow and click on the transition where the rule is configured

!print.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

On the right sidebar, the rule description will show the updated number of users that can transition requests.

!print2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The description considers the user that was deleted in the user count, but when you click on the rule you can only see the users that are still in the project.
h3. Additional notes

The same happens if you change the role of a user to one that doesn't have the 'Transition any request' permission.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Removing from a next-gen project a user that is added to a workflow transition rule won't decrease the number of users in the rule description

fields.description:
As per https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JSDECO-181:

Refined has two apps on the Atlassian Marketplace, Refined for Jira Cloud and Refined for Confluence cloud, that are runs outside of the Atlassian cloud. They make use of the Atlassian rest APIs to display information frmo Confluence, Jira and JSD. To authenticate users we make use of the Atlassian login that supports to add a url to redirect to after login is done
For JSD customers:
xxxxx.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/login?absolute=true&destination=xxx
For Atlassian users
https://id.atlassian.com/login?continue=$xxxxxx.atlassian.net/login?dest-url=xxx&application=ondemand

When customers get's invited to a service desk or if someone signs up themselves we don't seem to have an option to redirect the user back to refined after sign up. We would need this functionality to make it possible to keep users on the Refined site after sign up.
fields.summary: Feature request - Make it possible to redirect to specified url after sign up

fields.description:
We have a wish to start attaching service-related information to each customer in Jira Service Desk. Typical things we would like to capture are:
 * Serial numbers of products they own that we need to support,
 * Peripheral products they use that interface with our product,
 * Features they consider important or valuable.

It would be nice in this view to also get a usercentric view of their service history.
fields.summary: Customer-bound metadata

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a user while raising on behalf throws error "The reporter specified is not a user."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the Create issue button
 # In the "Raise on behalf" field, enter an unregistered email and other required fields. Click Create

h3. Expected Results
Issue is created and the email in the "Raise on behalf" field is added as the reporter.
h3. Actual Results
"The reporter specified is not a user."

h3. Workaround
Raise on behalf of customers in the Customer Portal
fields.summary: Creating a user while raising on behalf throws error "The reporter specified is not a user."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Comments are not loaded on new issue view. Issue is intermittent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a public comment
 # Load the issue on new issue view

h3. Expected Results
All comments are loaded for Jira users on new issue view

h3. Actual Results
Comments are not listed on new issue view
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-21 at 15.14.11.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-05-21 at 15.14.29.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Open the issues on old issue view
fields.summary: Comments are not loaded on new issue view

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to see more information about each customer on the *Customers* page of a *Jira Service Desk* project.

For example, a green check mark next to the customer's name indicating that they have completed their registration and possibly a last login activity column (or show this information on the user's card when hovering over them on the *Customers* page).

Other suggestions include the addition of phone numbers and contact details when adding customers as well. See duplicate tickets below for more information
fields.summary: Ability to see more information on Customers page about each user

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When an organization is added to an issue, the Organization Added customer notification is sent, and members of the organization must opt-in to new notifications. In the customer notification, there are no variables to add a link to *opt-in* to notifications, only to *opt-out*.

h3. Why is it important?

Members of the organization must always have to access the issues to opt-in for new notifications, so it would be good to have a link directly from the notification to opt-in for new notifications.

h3. Suggested resolution

Provide a variable to opt-in new notifications to be added to customer notifications
fields.summary: Provide a variable to opt in notification to be added to customer notifications

fields.description:
*Environment:* Cloud

*Problem Definition:* 
 Customers are not able to choose the Assignee on the portal.

If assignee field is added to the request form it has to be preset and hidden.

*Suggested Solution:* Allow customers to choose the assignee on the portal

*Why is this important:* 
+Use cases:+ 
 -Customer is internal and wants to assign a ticket to a specific person
 -Customer raises a new request and wants to continue working on it with a specific agent

*Workaround:*
 Use automation to take the value in a custom field from the portal and update the assignee field. 
 Not an ideal workaround as it can be tedious when there are many agents.
fields.summary: Ability for customers to choose the assignee in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It would be nice if Jira Service Desk mail audit logs had an additional column to show if messages were processed as a new ticket or added as a comment.
h3. Suggested resolution

Shows a column with the issue key on which the message was processed.
fields.summary: Improve mail audit logs

fields.description:
*4 Jan 2022 Update:*

*Hi all!* 

*The rollout of ProForma (Forms for Jira) is now in progress and should be available to all customers in the next few weeks.* 

*ProForma will make it possible to set a validator on a multi-choice field that specified the minimum number of choices required.*

*Regards,*

*Simon Herd*

*Principal Product Manager, Jira Service Management*

 
----
 

*Environment:* Cloud

*Description:*
+Use case:+ We have a checkbox field with a long list of options. We need to add a validator to allow the transition only it if at least 3 options are selected.

Currently we have one validator to add to the transition but no other further options.
|Field has single value Validator|Multi-select Field has not more than one value during transition.|

*Suggestion:*
Add new validators that can be used to validate checkbox fields to have multiple values

*Workaround:* 
Use add-on Proforma to achieve this
[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215833/proforma-forms-checklist-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
fields.summary: Ability to add validation checks for checkbox fields.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Although the "Allow other rules to trigger this rule" is unchecked/disabled, it still allows Automation for Jira rules to trigger it
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a rule in Automation for Jira to add a comment on Issue Created
 # Add a default "Comment updates reply status" and uncheck the "Allow other rules to trigger this rule"
# Create a request

h3. Expected Results
The rule "Comment updates reply status" would not be executed
h3. Actual Results
The rule "Comment updates reply status" is executed

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation for Jira rules trigger JSD automation rules while option "Allow other rules to trigger this rule" is disabled

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Knowledge Base doesn't reflect the cell background color in a table.

 !Screenshot 2020-05-20 17.48.10.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Take account of the specified colors.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Knowledge Base doesn't respect the cell colors

fields.description:
h3.Problem Definition
Currently, the organization field only can be select after the agent field in the "On behalf of" value.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to select the organization field and maybe can set an option to automatically field in the "On the behalf of" value.

h3. Why this is important
It makes the agent easier to create a ticket on behalf of the organization.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to select the "Organization" value before selecting the "On the behalf of" value.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Files attached to Confluence articles, such as PDF, PowerPoint, Excel, Word show an 'Edit file' button in the thumbnail. Clicking on this button downloads the file.

This can get a little confusing in JSD Knowledge Base as service desk customers don't have permission to edit any files.

!Screen Shot 2020-05-19 at 16.17.45.png|width=176,height=231!

  !Screen Shot 2020-08-26 at 13.59.24.png|width=295,height=397!
h3. Suggested solution

Remove this button, allowing service desk customers only to preview or download files from KB articles.
fields.summary: Remove the 'Edit file' button from files attachment thumbnails in KB articles

fields.description:
When adding checkboxes fields to the portal, the options are all listed on a single column, which can make the form unnecessarily extensive.

Having the options broken down on multiple columns would allow to keep using the fields, but having the portal visually more pleasant.
fields.summary: Have checkboxes fields display as multiple columns on the portal

fields.description: We use Jira SD in a way to where automation automatically moves a Jira SD into into a Jira Software project.  Currently, there is no way for the automation to migrate custom field data from Jira SD into Jira Software.  We would like this functionality to be added.
fields.summary: Automation allows for custom fields to be transferred to other Jira Software projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding comments containing backslashes causes the comments to not be rendered correctly in the old issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the customer portal, add 
 # add the comment {code}C:\Program Files\Company\Software{code}

h3. Expected Results
comment displays {code}C:\Program Files\Company\Software{code}
h3. Actual Results
comment displays as {code}C:
Program Files\\Company
Software{code}

h3. Workaround
Use the code snippet in the customer portal
fields.summary: Adding comments with backslashes in the customer portal causes the comments to not render correctly

fields.description:
Currently, any changes made to the workflow status wont automatically reflect the automation rule i.e if we make any changes in the workflow status name, the admin should go separately and make the changes in the automation rules.

It will be great if there is a connected service between these two-component so that the changes affect automatically.
fields.summary: Changes made to the workflow should refelect in the automation rules as well

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever we empty out our queue in GSAC, it usually gives a message congratulating us for cleaning up the queue. Sometimes these messages are suggesting that we do things like "high five our neighbor" or "go on a coffee run."  See picture for an example. !Screen Shot 2020-05-15 at 5.42.53 PM.png!
h3. Expected Results

 

We would like to replace these messages with something more quarantine appropriate like, "Your queue is empty. Respect social distancing and stay inside!"

If this could get added, that would be great. I hope you have a wonderful weekend! ;)
fields.summary: More Quarantine Friendly Empty Queue Messaging

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When going to the *General Settings* page and setting *Allow unassigned issues* to *OFF*, *Assignee* becomes *REQUIRED* in *Field configurations* and *Request types* have it forced on and hidden. Setting the *Default Assignee* in the *Details* page of a project to *Project lead* doesn't automatically address this.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set project to default assign all tickets to *Project lead* in project *Details*
 # Set *Allow unassigned issues* to *OFF* in *General settings*
 # Receive errors about the *Assignee* field in all *Request types*

h3. Expected Results
No errors occur and all tickets are automatically assigned to the *Project lead*.

h3. Actual Results
Errors occur due to the *Assignee* field not having a value.

h3. Workaround

Set *Allow unassigned issues* to *ON* and use the *Default Assignee* option the project's *Details* page or setup an *Automation* rule to set the *Assignee* on issue creation.
fields.summary: Disallowing unassigned issues forces Assignee as Required and breaks Request types

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
Customers need to have additional fields visible/available on the portal after the request is approved and transitioned further.

*Suggested Solution*
Ability to have additional fields visible/available on the portal after the request is approved and transitioned further.

*Why this is important*
It would be good to have additional fields after a certain transition(approval), that would give customers more information and visibility on the ongoing request.
fields.summary: Display certain fields to Customers only after ticket reached a certain status in the workflow.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Service Desk Cloud*. Using *Jira Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-6850].
  {panel}


h3. Problem Definition
Customer notifications do not include agent's avatar when the agent updates/edits the request. 


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if the email notifications that customers receive contained the Agent's Jira avatar somewhere in the message itself.   This can produce a misalignment since Jira Core notifications do this.

h3. Why this is important
Helps to establish a closer understanding between customers and Agents that these are real people working behind these issues/requests.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Customer notifications should display the agent's avatar when they receive emails based on agent's actions

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When the [Statuspage for Jira Service Desk add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216079/statuspage-for-jira-service-desk?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] is installed, the customer portal will always try to load the status page panel and will leave a blank space.
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/ApujP0Ae

On bigger screens, like 4K (3840 × 2160), it will leave a big blank space, see the video below:
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/eDu6Kxle

h3. Why is it important?

The portal will have a blank space above the projects, which makes it hard to find the projects.

h3. Suggested resolution

Disable Statuspage panel from the customer portal when it is empty.
fields.summary: Disable Statuspage panel from the customer portal when it is empty

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When creating a new article on Confluence, the page will be created using the new editor, but while looking at the same article in the knowledge base portal, it will look like the old editor.

h3. Why is it important?

The pages look different from Confluence and the portal.

h3. Suggested resolution

Enable the Confluence new editor view on knowledge base articles.
fields.summary: Enable the new Confluence Editor view on portal knowledge base view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Satisfaction Date duplicated in history

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the notification with the feedback survey.
# Click on the rating. _At this time, the CSAT rating will be posted on the ticket_
# Keep the feedback window open for a few minutes
# Finally, add the comment. This will cause the satisfaction date to be updated to the comment timestamp, resulting in two entries on the issue history.

h3. Expected Results
* There should be only one satisfaction date entry in the resolved ticket.

h3. Actual Results
* There are multiple satisfaction date entries in the resolved ticket.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Satisfaction Date duplicated in history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sometimes when reordering knowledge base categories using drag and drop, the re-ordering doesn't work (i.e. the category goes back to its original position). This seems to happen most when trying to re-order the bottom category or when re-ordering multiple times.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD project with a linked Knowledge Base in Confluence
 # Go to the Knowledge Base project navigation to manage categories
# Create at least 3 categories
# Drag and drop to re-order the categories

h3. Expected Results
Every drag and drop changes the order of the categories

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes the drag and drop doesn't work

h3. Workaround
Sometimes refreshing the page allows you to drag and drop successfully, but trying to drag the bottom category never works.
fields.summary: Drag and drop reordering knowledge base categories is sometimes broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Certain characters in *Jira Service Desk* customer notifications show incorrectly in the notification email, but not the template editor. This happens when the language is set to German, but not when set to English (in English, the characters are rendered correctly).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set instance or project language  to German
 # Have a customer notification (e.g., customer invited) with certain characters (e.g., ü or ß)
 # Observe (via the emailed notification) that the characters show as Ã¼ or ÃŸ

h3. Expected Results
ü shows as ü in the emailed customer notification and ß shows as ß in the customer notification.

h3. Actual Results
ü shows as Ã¼ and ß shows as ÃŸ.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Some German characters are malformed in Customer Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When an issue is closed on a Software board, we can see a strikethrough in the issue key. On Service Desk queues, when the issue gets closed the same strikethrough is not present.

h3. Suggested resolution

Ability to show the strikethrough on Service Desk tickets in queues.
fields.summary: Show the strikethrough on closed tickets in queues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue is created on our SD project, if there is a Confluence space linked as a knowledge base, some suggested articles get mentioned in the issue. 
With the article list, JIRA also grants you an option to create a new article based on a template. 
However, when the *Troubleshooting* template is disabled on Confluence, JIRA doesn't care about it and allows you to choose this template to create your page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
First of all, make sure to have Confluence space linked as a knowledge base on your JIRA SD project.
*On Confluence*:
# Create a page on Confluence called *ZZ Top rules* on your knowledge base space;
# On this space, go to *Space Settings > Content Tools > Templates*;
# Find the *Troubleshoot* template and disable it.

*On JIRA*:
# Go to your SD project and create an issue with a summary and description *ZZ Top rules* too;
# The Confluence article should be suggested at the issue's sidebar - place your mouse cursor there and click over the arrow;
# Click over the *+* button;
# In the *Template* option, click to get the template you want.

h3. Expected Results
The *Troubleshooting* template shouldn't be shown there, as it is disabled for that space.

h3. Actual Results
The *Troubleshooting* template is shown.

*Notes*:
* it doesn't matter if you disable the template in the Global Templates or directly in the space, the template will be shown anyway.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JIRA allows to create an article with a disabled Confluence template
